result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge plus $100 drug testing fees=$618 

In regard to the Court ordered financial obligations, the Court allows an installment payment plan of $50 per month commencing on 12/14/16 and on the 14th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-compliance will result in 13 days in Jail with Work Release and Huber privileges, consecutive

--to serve 5 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release and Huber privileges including for AODA assessment, to commence on 1/7/17 at 6:00pm.

--the Court authorizes transfer of the service of this Jail term to the Waukesha County Jail, the Milwaukee County Jail, the Racine County Jail, the Kenosha County Jail or another county Jail--conditional on there being no passive service of the jail term (no house arrest, no day-reporting and no electronic monitoring is to be used for service of this Jail term); the sentence is to be served under the same conditions as would occur in the Jefferson County Jail

--the Court informs Mr. Sanchez that he is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system;  there will be testing when Mr. Sanchez reports to the Jail and non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/Work-Release privileges without further process. The Court will deny any request for reinstatement of the Huber/Work-Release privileges if such revocation of Huber/Work-Release privileges occurs.

--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge= $518 

In regard to the Court ordered financial obligations, the Court allows an installment payment plan of $50 per month commencing on 12/14/16 and on the 14th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-compliance will result in 13 days in Jail with Work Release and Huber privileges, consecutive

records.addlTxt: Huber Law/Work Release Notification

[MK] case called at 2:55pm. 
Attorney Michael H. Kopp in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Kopp expresses concern regarding the timing of today's hearing related to his travel time and family schedule-needs.
recess 2:58pm, reconvene 3:05pm; the Defendant Jesus Sanchez is now also present. 
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance.
ADA Beck recites factual corrections to the Pre-Sentence Investigation Report:  on page 5, related to the terms of the sentences in the Milwaukee County conviction and in Waukesha County Case #08CF385 conviction. 
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 
Mr. Sanchez makes a statement.

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Sanchez: 
--to serve 5 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release and Huber privileges including for AODA assessment, to commence on 1/7/17 at 6:00pm.
--the Court authorizes transfer of the service of this Jail term to the Waukesha County Jail, the Milwaukee County Jail, the Racine County Jail, the Kenosha County Jail or another county Jail--conditional on there being no passive service of the jail term (no house arrest, no day-reporting and no electronic monitoring is to be used for service of this Jail term); the sentence is to be served under the same conditions as would occur in the Jefferson County Jail
--the Court informs Mr. Sanchez that he is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system;  there will be testing when Mr. Sanchez reports to the Jail and non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/Work-Release privileges without further process. The Court will deny any request for reinstatement of the Huber/Work-Release privileges if such revocation of Huber/Work-Release privileges occurs.
--days credit for time already served:  1 day
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge plus $100 drug testing fees=$618 


On Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Sanchez: 
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge= $518 

In regard to the Court ordered financial obligations, the Court allows an installment payment plan of $50 per month commencing on 12/14/16 and on the 14th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-compliance will result in 13 days in Jail with Work Release and Huber privileges, consecutive

The Court clarifies that it is not ordering any suspension of driving privileges. 
recess 3:55pm.
cc: DA & Attorney Kopp by COC on 10/31/16. sf
Sentencing hearing on November 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
with JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Case called at 8:15am [MA]
Defendant Jesus  Sanchez in court with Attorney Michael H. Kopp.  Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " GUILTY " entered on Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #3.

Defense requests a PSI without recommendation
--no objection from ADA Teuber

The Court orders the DOC conduct a Pre Sentence Investigation, the leaves to the discretion of DOC whether recommendation is made

The Court directs Clerk to prepare proper order; Clerk prepares order and presents to the Court for endorsement.
recess: 8:46am

NEXT: Sentencing on 11/14/16 at 3:00pm
Plea hearing on September 13, 2016 at 08:10 am.

[MK] case called at 9:39am. 
Defendant Jesus  Sanchez in court with Attorney Michael H. Kopp.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Plea Hearing today, however Attorney Kopp requests adjourning, indicating that he needs further time to meet with Mr. Sanchez about the plea-paperwork and to discuss the possibility of requesting a PSI in this case. 
recess 9:42am
[Post Hearing/Off-Record Mr. Sanchez verifies to the clerk that his address remains at S. 36th Street in Milwaukee.]

NEXT:  Plea Hearing (possible Sentencing or possible PSI-request) on 9/13/16 at 8:10am.
Plea hearing on August 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 9:31 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jesus Sanchez in court with Attorney Michael H. Kopp. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court notes that ADA Hall indicated off-record that there is victim rights compliance if matter would be called early
Court so finds
Atty Kopp reviews prior hearing on Tuesday in which Mr. Sanchez did not appear. Mr. Sanchez believed the STC was set for June 20th. Requests the Court set plea date in approximately 45 days
off-record: 9:34 - 9:38 am for scheduling
Clerk announces date for the record
Recess: 9:39 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Plea Hearing 8/15/16 at 10:00 am - Send notice
Status conference on June 16, 2016 at 10:00 am. - Defendant's notice was mailed - not in person

Case called at 10:33 am [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Jennifer Weber presiding for BrIII]
Attorney Michael H. Kopp in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jesus Sanchez not in court.
Atty Kopp informs the Court that he has no explanation for Mr. Sanchez's non-appearance. Did tell Mr. Sanchez he did not need to appear at PTC, may be misunderstood that he did not need to appear today as told him we would be asking for a plea date. Have had good communication with Mr. Sanchez throughout the case. Request that the Court impose and stay a warrant to produce Mr. Sanchez.
ADA Hall - no objection to defense request
Court notes that It will not issue warrant since matter is set in two days
Recess: 10:40 am 

NEXT: Notices to Counsel in Court/Defendant's Mailed - Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 10:00 am.
State's
Status conference on June 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2016 at 09:20 am.

Case called at 3:00pm [mo]
Defendant Jesus Sanchez in court with attorney Michael H. Kopp.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Mr.Sanchez waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered on all counts
recess: 3:03pm

Case called at 1:17 pm [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Jennifer Weber presiding for BrII]
Defendant Jesus Sanchez appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Susan Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hagemann informs the Court that they have not completed the financial evaluation so SPDs appearance today will be for bond purposes only
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

DOB and address confirmed accurate; Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $500 CASH bond, with conditions:
-No Contact with Hector Ramirez Torres
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
Recess: 1:28 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 3/15/16 at 3:00 pm  - Send notices
